title: Crispy Cheesy Rice Pancakes

metadata.storage: Cooked pancakes keep in the fridge for up to 2 days; reheat in a pan or toaster
metadata.reheating: Pan fry over medium heat for 2‚Äì3 minutes per side until crispy again
metadata.pairing: Yogurt dip, sour cream, or any sauce of your choice

instructions.step: In a bowl, combine rice, cheese, egg, flour (or breadcrumbs), green onions, and any spices or add-ins.
instructions.title: Mix It Up

instructions.step: Mix until it holds together. If it feels too loose, add a bit more flour or breadcrumbs.
instructions.title: Check Consistency

instructions.step: Scoop about ¬º cup of the mixture and form into a small pancake or patty with your hands. Slightly flatten them‚Äînot too thin, or they'll break.
instructions.title: Form Patties

instructions.step: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a touch of oil or butter.
instructions.title: Heat the Pan

instructions.step: Cook each patty for about 3‚Äì4 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy.
instructions.title: Pan-Fry to Perfection

instructions.step: Place on a paper towel briefly to remove excess oil, then serve hot!
instructions.title: Drain & Serve

steps.step: Mix yogurt, minced garlic, lemon juice, chopped herbs, salt, and pepper. Let sit for 10 minutes so flavors mingle. Perfect contrast to the warm, melty pancake.
Stir together mayo, sriracha, lemon juice, and optional pinch of sugar. Great if your pancakes have a touch of heat or smoky cheese.
Combine chopped cherry tomatoes, vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, and fresh herbs. A quick-fix zingy and vibrant dip.

notes: These pancakes are a beautiful alchemy of leftovers! Use day-old rice for the best texture‚Äîfresh rice can get too mushy. Don't skip the frying step; the crispy exterior is what makes them special. Serve with any dipping sauce you love: yogurt dips, sour cream, sriracha mayo, or a fresh tomato relish.
